intro: Maesobotrya pierlotii, commonly known as the African moonflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae and is characterized by its large, showy white flowers that open at night. The plant has compound leaves with elongated leaflets and produces small, fleshy fruits that are edible. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in forested areas. Its nocturnal blooming habit makes it a unique and attractive species in botanical gardens.
